meanings.definition: The quality of being scrupulous or having moral integrity.
meanings.sent1: Her scrupulosities in always telling the truth earned her the respect of her peers.
meanings.sent2: His scrupulosities in following the rules made him a trustworthy employee.
meanings.sent3: The detective's scrupulosities in solving the case led to a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: The artist's scrupulosities in capturing every detail made the painting come to life.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's scrupulosities in grading assignments ensured fairness for all students.

meanings.definition: An instance of being excessively concerned with moral or ethical principles.
meanings.sent1: His scrupulosities about recycling every piece of paper bordered on obsession.
meanings.sent2: The politician's scrupulosities about transparency gained the trust of the public.
meanings.sent3: The chef's scrupulosities about using organic ingredients made for a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: Her scrupulosities about punctuality were like clockwork in the office.
meanings.sent5: The student's scrupulosities about plagiarism prevention were evident in every citation.

meanings.definition: An act of being meticulous or careful in one's actions.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon's scrupulosities during the operation saved the patient's life.
meanings.sent2: The architect's scrupulosities in designing the building ensured its stability.
meanings.sent3: The explorer's scrupulosities in packing supplies prevented any mishaps on the journey.
meanings.sent4: His scrupulosities in checking the details avoided any errors in the report.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's scrupulosities in pruning the plants kept the garden flourishing.
